channel.title: SubStrings
channel.description: How do I know what they are? I heard its something based off the ammounce of letters and spaces or something...any help? I really need to get learning player-saving

item.title: SubStrings
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:10, topic:241987”]Yeah, I believe mine was like that also.
Just use write(String) instead, Chassy.

Well that was saving my moreinfo. Anyway, thanks guys, this will REALLY help a lot.

No problem.[/quote]would it still need to identify the 20?

Read full topic

item.title: SubStrings
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

            characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);

So this is substring 0, 20 because character-strarter = is 20 characters counting spaces, the letters and the equal sign? and 0 is where it starting, and 20 is where it is ending?

Read full topic

item.title: SubStrings
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:3, topic:241987”]http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/String.html#substring(int)

I made a tutorial, but it’s likely to get locked, because the mods aren’t going to think that it’s teaching anything. how about you tell them not to lock it and maybe they’ll accept it.

brb with the tut.

Beat you to it. :P[/quote]too bad you’re gay and Ima post mine so that it’s on mopar. i’ll include your link, and maybe it will be more appealing to the mods. or maybe they’ll just lock it saying “no need, I’m a mod, etc, etc, etc…” ;]
